title: Why Riot should make an RTS or Dungeon Crawler.
body:
#Real Time Strategy:
A great opportunity to expand lore as RTS are known for.

Take the MOBA genre in reverse to it's roots.

We get to see our favorite characters leading/murdering/saving people/armies.

Opens up a second E-Sport opportunity.

Riot can shove it in Blizzard's face by doing it better and making it actually strategic.

#Dungeon Crawler
A great opportunity to expand lore as Dungeon Crawlers are known for.

Essentially PvE LoL.

We could finally see what our champions are capable of without being held back by PvP balance.

Greatly expand on champion kits and characters.

Shyvana can finally properly be Dirgen and rek shiz.

#Either way
Riot can make themselves more than a one-trick-wonder and show the world they have lasting value as a company.

We as players can get more insight into Runeterra and enjoy our characters and lore in another ~~less toxic~~ fun format.

Other considerations:
Fighting game
MMORPG
Action RPG
Tower Defense

Can you think of other fun Genres to take Runeterra into?
Do you have reasons you'd love to see a Runeterra RTS or Dungeon Crawler?
Post below!

This is exactly what I want to see, especially relating things to the universe and the lore.  Question is, how would it be implemented?  Would there be champion specific missions that you play to unlock points in their backstory (solo, locked character)?  Would they be multiplayer missions with faction-based champ select and objectives (co-op, small selection)?  Would they be simply game-modes?  In the long run additions like this could make the game so much better, but it takes a lot of resources and take a long time to implement.
What I don't want to see is something like Runescape, where you create your own character and playstyle within an open world.  It would detract from the whole "Legends" aspect of the game.

RTS would be way more viable. The different league factions would translate very well into pseudo-asymmetrical multiplayer similar to Starcraft's races.

Creating interesting levels, items, creeps, and champion-specific classes for a Dungeon Crawler would require significantly more resources and be dependent on continuous content or extreme replayability that I doubt Riot could satisfactorily accomplish.

I imagine the faction thing could work decently well for both an RTS or a 4X game is they wanted something slower and more outright strategic (turn-based in this case, as opposed to the few RTS-4X games). 

I'd probably hedge my bets on RTS of the two, though, because I feel that with the current 4X titles on the market the marketshare isn't particularly huge for a new IP being thrown into the mix and it'd sell likely off of the name alone unless it was so good that it became widely acclaimed. I'd kinda like seeing a Runeterra-based RTS made in the spirit of BFME.
